Another fix, which I pretty sure will work, is tell Bazel within the repo rule that it depends on .git/HEAD. Then whenever that file changes Im pretty sure the repo rule should be rerun. I think you can add something like...

r = repository_ctx.execute(["test", "-f", "%s/.git/logs/HEAD" % tensorflow_root_path])
if r.return_code == 0:
unused_var = repository_ctx.path(Label("//:.git/HEAD")) # pylint: disable=unused-variable

...to the git_configure repo rule.

body:
Another fix, which I pretty sure will work, is tell Bazel within the repo rule that it depends on .git/HEAD. Then whenever that file changes Im pretty sure the repo rule should be rerun. I think you can add something like...

r = repository_ctx.execute(["test", "-f", "%s/.git/logs/HEAD" % tensorflow_root_path])
if r.return_code == 0:
    unused_var = repository_ctx.path(Label("//:.git/HEAD"))  # pylint: disable=unused-variable

...to the git_configure repo rule.
